info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:00PM EDT until August 04 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTY... At 459 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Poultney Village, or 7 miles southeast of Whitehall, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Granville, Hampton, Truthville, Raceville, Middle Granville, Hampton Flats, West Granville, North Granville and East Whitehall. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
